name: Rabindranath Tagore
description: Poet, writer, and the first non-European Nobel Laureate in Literature.

name: Swami Vivekananda
description: Spiritual leader and philosopher who introduced Vedanta and Yoga to the Western world.
awards: Legacy as key figure in Indian spiritual revival

name: Satyajit Ray
description: Legendary filmmaker known for the Apu Trilogy and pioneering Indian cinema.

name: Jagadish Chandra Bose
description: Scientist and polymath who pioneered wireless communication and plant physiology.
awards: Companion of the Order of the Indian Empire (1903)

name: Subhas Chandra Bose
description: Indian nationalist and leader of the Indian National Army (INA).
awards: Posthumous recognition as a freedom fighter

name: Satyendranath Bose
description: Pioneer of quantum mechanics, known for Bose-Einstein statistics.

name: Rash Behari Bose
description: Key revolutionary leader who helped form the Indian National Army in Japan.

name: Sri Ramakrishna Paramhansa
description: Mystic saint and spiritual teacher of Swami Vivekananda.

name: Sri Aurobindo Ghose
description: Indian nationalist turned yogi, philosopher, and poet.

name: Khudiram Bose
description: One of the youngest revolutionaries executed during India's freedom struggle.

name: Leela Roy
description: Social reformer and revolutionary, co-founder of women's rights movements.

name: Matangini Hazra
description: Elderly activist martyred during the Quit India Movement.

name: Binay, Badal & Dinesh
description: The revolutionary trio behind the Writers' Building attack in 1930.

name: Raja Ram Mohan Roy
description: Founder of the Brahmo Samaj and a pioneer of Indian social reform and modern education.

name: Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar
description: Key figure in the Bengal Renaissance, champion of women's education and widow remarriage.

name: Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay
description: Author of 'Vande Mataram', novelist and key figure in Bengali literature and nationalism.

name: Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay
description: One of the most popular Bengali novelists, known for his realistic depiction of society.

name: Master Da Surya Sen
description: Revolutionary leader of the Chittagong Armoury Raid against British rule.
location: Noapara, Chittagong, Bengal Presidency, British India

name: Bagha Jatin
description: Courageous revolutionary leader known for his fierce resistance against British forces.
location: Koya, Nadia district, Bengal Presidency, British India

name: Radhabinod Pal
description: Indian jurist known for his dissenting judgment at the Tokyo War Crimes Tribunal after World War II.
location: Kushtia, Bengal Presidency, British India (now Bangladesh)

name: Kazi Nazrul Islam
description: Revolutionary poet, writer, and musician known as the 'Rebel Poet' of Bengal.

name: Sukumar Ray
description: Bengali author and poet famous for his nonsense literature and children's classics like 'Abol Tabol'.

name: Michael Madhusudan Dutt
description: Pioneer of Bengali blank verse and a key figure in the Bengal Renaissance.
